page.title: 01Overall view of Hanley Swan
page.content: This rural area is mainly agricultural but includes two Hanley villages, Hanley Swan and Hanley Castle. It lies at the foot of the Malvern Hills, and the hills are visible forming an attractive backcloth to this very beautiful district. Small to average sized farms dominate the area.There are caravan parks nearby so tourists are encouraged to discover and enjoy what the countryside has to offer,by following well marked footpaths. However this is not an area which encourages large numbers of visitors as it has few facilities and enjoys its quietness and privacy. Hanley Swan is well known locally for its pond and village green, on which stands an old and huge oak tree. This affords local and visiting artists much interest.
